eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FirstPersonCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move the camera to look though objects eyes.
description: Move the camera to look though objects eyes.
This extension can be used with the "Mouse pointer lock" or "Gamepad" extension to build a first person camera.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera to look though _PARAM1_ eyes. The object must look to the right when all its angles are 0 and the top of its head be toward Z+.
eventsFunctions.name: LookFromObjectEyes
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move the camera of _PARAM2_ to look though _PARAM1_ eyes

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Convert3dToScreenPosition
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This extension provides functionality to convert 3D position to screen position.
description: This extension provides functionality to convert 3D position to screen position.
- "Overlap" action: Overlaps objects with a 3D object.

eventsFunctions.description:
Overlaps objects with a 3D object.
⚠️ For objects to overlap correctly, they must be on a different layer than the 3D object.
eventsFunctions.name: Overlap

inlineCode: const Offset3D = new THREE.Vector3(OffsetX, OffsetY, OffsetZ);

parameters.longDescription: Hide 2D objects when 3D objects are behind the 3D camera.
parameters.name: Hide
